meta.content: Waelder ISD and its community is committed to providing the best educational environment to ensure that all students reach their fullest potential to become responsible and productive members of society.

div.div: Waelder ISD and its community is committed to providing the best educational environment to ensure that all students reach their fullest potential to become responsible and productive members of society.

div.div: Check your email periodically for information, updates & news from WISD

h3.a: Waelder School: Waelder ISD has extended district closure through April 30th

div.div: Staff to return on May 1st, and students to return on May 4th. See story
Information & resource websites

h3.a: Gov. Abbot temporarily suspends Public Records Requests for School Districts

div.div: *see story* WISD is currently not processing open record requests. We will resume processing requests within the timeframe required by state law once school reopens and we have more than a skeleton crew available at our school facilities.

h3.a: NOTE TIME CHANGE & PROCEDURE FOR WISD

div.div: See Story for to go meals for WISD students and children under 18 yoa & lesson pickup time change & procedures beginning Monday March 30th

Waelder ISD has teamed up with GermBlast, to minimize cold and flu germs at our schools. GermBlast treats each school three times per school year, or more if needed due to extended illnesses. See Story
WISD Board of Trustees Meetings Link

WISD phone numbers. Central Office (830) 239-5600 Elementary Office (830) 239-5601 Secondary Office (830) 239-5602 Central Office Fax (830) 239-5603 Elementary Fax (830) 239-5603 Secondary Fax (830) 239-5605 *See Story
To learn more about your child's STAAR performance and how you can provide additional support at home, visit TexasAssessment.gov
Special entry into athletic events at a discounted price. See Coach Graves
2019 Yearbooks on Sale Now! $25. August Delivery

h3.a: TEXAS PUBLIC SCHOOL for Parents & Students

div.div:
Welcome to Texas public school! Sending your kindergartener to his or her first day of school? If your child is five or six years old and ready to begin public school, take the first steps of this exciting journey by finding your school and enrolling your child.
¡Bienvenidos! Cuando su hijo empieza por primera vez la escuela, es probable que a usted se le ocurran miles de preguntas. Comienzan aquí! Más información en Español será publicada en los próximos pocos meses.

Waelder Independent School District is using a visitor management system (Raptor) in our schools. This system allows us to track visitors, contractors, volunteers, and provide us with a safer more monitored environment for our students and staff. *SEE STORY

h3.a: "REMIND" Phone Application for Messaging Parents & Students

div.div: Waelder ISD is now using the "REMIND" messaging application district-wide. If you're not already familiar with Remind, it's a classroom communication app that makes it easy to stay involved with your child's learning. Remind is free to use, and you'll be able to get and send messages on any device—even right from your phone. Official accounts are created for all the educators, parents, and students at Waelder ISD. [You may watch video demo (*see link) to get a better sense of the onboarding experience to Remind. We're excited for a better way to stay connected with you!]
*see attached
